15.97. Let p be a prime. A group G satisfies the p-minimal condition if there are no infinite descending chains G1 > G2 > . . . of subgroups of G such that each difference Gi \ Gi+1 contains a p-element (S. N. Chernikov). Suppose that a locally finite group G satisfies the p-minimal condition and has a subnormal series each of whose factors is finite or a p′-group. Is it true that all p-elements of G generate a Chernikov subgroup?
N. S. Chernikov
